comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945

The following ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs from time to time (with a different index). Sorry, i could not find a way to reproduce this bug:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-12-05 08:23:06.281
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "C/C++ Indexer".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -48886
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.getChunk(Database.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.putInt(Database.java:248)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.addBlock(Database.java:216)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.free(Database.java:233)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.ShortString.delete(ShortString.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.PDOMMacro.delete(PDOMMacro.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.PDOMFile.clear(PDOMFile.java:199)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullHandleDelta.removeTU(PDOMFullHandleDelta.java:208)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullHandleDelta.run(PDOMFullHandleDelta.java:97)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMIndexerJob.run(PDOMIndexerJob.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
!SESSION 2006-12-05 08:30:33.968 -----------------------------------------------

This does occur occasionally when the index is corrupted. The best solution is to reindex the projects in your workspace. I'll leave this bug open to find a way to improve the robustness of the index in this situation.
Hmm, I have never seen that. Doug, did you also see this happen with 4.0?
This has not occured with 4.0 over the last 6 months. Please reopen if you see this problem with 4.0.
